Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the impact and significance of the listed restrictions on women in 1971.
Understate: The claim may understate the progress made in certain areas, such as the availability of birth control pills and women's access to education.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or sources to support the assertion that these were the only nine things women couldn't do in 1971.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all women faced the same restrictions and challenges in all states, which may not have been the case.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative factors or societal norms that may have influenced the listed restrictions on women in 1971.
